abstract: Flextronics International, a company that manufactures electronics for customers such as Cisco, Dell and Eastman Kodak, said Monday it will acquire rival Solectron in a deal it valued at $3.6 billion. The combination would create company with annual revenue of more than $30 billion, Singapore-based Flextronics said in a press release.
lead_paragraph: Flextronics International, a company that manufactures electronics for customers such as Cisco, Dell and Eastman Kodak, said Monday it will acquire rival Solectron in a deal it valued at $3.6 billion. The combination would create company with annual revenue of more than $30 billion, Singapore-based Flextronics said in a press release.

headline.main: Flextronics to Buy Rival in $3.6 Billion Deal
